Fields.DialogueText: I'm bored.  And hungry!  Good thing dinner is almost ready.
*ALARM*
Aww, nuts!
@BATTLE
I'm still getting used to all this diversity in the mess hall. It's great to not have to eat the same thing every day.
It *is* pretty nice, isn't it?
Yeah, I mean, I can't get enough of the actual fresh fruit.
I know, it's delicious, right?
Kitakami? Is that... Are you eating my apple?
You should've been eating it instead of chatting. I could hear it begging me to bite into it the moment I walked in!

Fields.MenuText: Kitakami, I think you need to apologize. Now.
I can kind of see her point.
You could've just gotten your own tray, you know.

Fields.DialogueText: Why? I helped this apple fulfill its destiny. Better in my mouth than rotting on his tray!
See, Kanchou's on my side. So chin up and start eating the rest of your food before I snatch that too!
But the trays are so far away! This tasty little apple was right here.
Besides, who do you think you have to thank for getting this plethora of food? It wasn't the Kanchou's idea, that's for sure!
I'll admit it, it was a good idea to spruce up the menu. That doesn't mean you should make a habit of stealing food from the crew.
Fine, here you go--it was just a joke. Enjoy. I'm gonna go see how the rest of the ship's liking the new food.
There's a big bite out of it now...
Yikes... that really is freaky. Where'd you find that old mask?
That's a long story. Actually, it's a bit of a legend. You sure you want to hear it? Once you do, you can never unhear it!
On second thought... maybe not.
Why are you backing up? It's not gonna bite or nothing! Not while the sun's still out at least...
What do you mean by that?!
Oh, nothing. Wanna touch it?
Uh... you know what, I think I have somewhere to be.
What's going on over here?
Oh, uh, Captain, I was just getting back to work. See ya!
Oh, no fun, you let him get away!
Well, it looked like you were terrorizing him.
That's the fun of it! He seemed down, and it's fun to be a little scared sometimes. He actually thought this old thing was cursed.

Fields.MenuText: It's not... right?
There are better ways to cheer people up. Don't jump straight to scaring them, okay?
So you just carry an old wooden mask with you all the time?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know. What do you think, Kanchou? Would you care to hear about the curse of the... Mask-wearing... Barber?
So you want me to just go around giving people hugs?! That doesn't seem nearly as fun to me.
Well, it's a great conversation starter.  I mean, just look at it!
*ALARM*
Morganas! Better put that mask away, we've got a fight on our hands.
Maybe I'll wear it into battle like a war mask! Think the Morganas will be as afraid of it as that crewman?
I guess it's worth a shot.
@BATTLE
That's the best you can do?!
Mō - give me a break! It's hard coming up with stuff on the spot like that.
*ALARM*
Aha! Perfect time to test out my mask!
@BATTLE
Kanchou. I have concerns about the safety of our crew.
You have my attention.
*WHAM*
That's a pretty large axe. Is this the safety concern?
No, the lack of these is the safety concern!
What do you mean?
I mean the crew isn't properly prepared for hand-to-hand combat.

Fields.MenuText: So you want us to pass out huge axes to the crew? That hardly seems safe.
Hmmm... it might be a good idea to prepare for close combat.
Before we talk about this any further, I'm going to need you to put that weapon away.

Fields.DialogueText: It's more safe than having no way to defend themselves when the Morganas bite them in half!
Right! See, we're so much alike! We could practically finish each other's sentences.
This? This isn't a weapon--it's ceremonial. It's way too heavy and dull to be used properly in a fight. Hasn't stopped me yet though.
Close-quarters combat might be a good skill to have, but I honestly don't see a lot of practical use for it.
You should always expect the unexpected, Kanchou. Who knows what could happen tomorrow?
All I know is that giant axes aren't really ideal for fights in confined spaces. And in any battles on deck your swing would be constrained by all the other crew members around.
There's a reason the things aren't already standard equipment, disappointing as it may be.
Fine... no axes. How about spears, though?
Kitakami...
Oh no! Morganas!
We'll take care of them!
@BATTLE
Looks like we're good! Not a single Morgana in sight!
Fantastic work, everybody! Another group of Morganas taken care of.
Wait, Kanchou, I think I'm sensing more Morganas nearby... Maybe these binoculars are broken or something.
Broken? What do you mean?
I don't know... I uh, I think you should check for yourself.
Sure. It... looks pretty clear to me.
You don't see anything?
No. Maybe they're subs?
Or they're just too... close!
Ahhh! Kitakami, you scared the hell out of me. Why would you do that?!
It was just a joke. Calm down, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: I don't care. Don't do that.
So... we're actually in the clear, right?
I bet these aren't even broken, are they?

Fields.DialogueText: Yikes, I'm sorry. I didn't think you'd take it so seriously.
Yeah, of course we are. I wouldn't be joking around if Morganas were still nearby.
Obviously. We just bought those, didn't we?
All right, I'm going to go catch my breath - while you take these binoculars and stay on watch.
Fine. I'll keep my eyes open.
And I don't want you trying that trick on anyone else, you hear me?
Mō! You're no fun!
Have you changed your mind about that armor yet?
Nope, I still think my speed is more important.
Speed isn't everything. Sooner or later you'll take a hit.
You know who says stuff like that? Slow people.
What's going on here?
Oh, hey, Kanchou! Have you met Kai? He's a top-notch officer, and a good pal of mine.
Kanchou.
Actually, you have great timing, Kanchou. Do you think I need more armor?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe a little. It couldn't hurt to bolster our defense.
And sacrifice your speed? Never.
It's a moot point. Belle upgrade regulations are what they are.

Fields.DialogueText: Ugh, you sound just like Kai...
Exactly! I'm glad to see that somebody gets it.
Well, that's inspiring.
I'm not suggesting we double your weight with armor, I'm just suggesting some light---
Wait a minute, did you just call me fat?!
*RUMBLE*
*ALARM*
We're under attack!
Looks like you were saved by the bell, Kai.
@BATTLE
Today is boring.
*ALARM*
Today is slightly less boring.
@BATTLE
Kanchou! Why is today so boring?
Well, I don't know what to say about that.
Entertain me. I need something fun to do.

Fields.MenuText: You could read.
Have you tried getting to know the crew?
Well, we could look over our tactics for battling the Morganas.

Fields.DialogueText: Books? I ask for something fun and you come to me with books? Do I look boring to you?!
I've tried, but... most of them can't take a joke.
Are you trying to punish me? Did I do something to make you angry? That sounds duller than dull!
Not everything in life is fun, Kitakami...
Well, it should be.
Even war?
Especially war! We need to keep our spirits up, or else we'll just be easy pickin's for the Morganas.
Sounds like you found something to do then.
Huh?
Go work on keeping all our spirits up. Sounds like it'll take a lot of effort.
Hmmm... Sounds like... it could be pretty fun! I've got this!
We've got more Morganas coming!
Oh dear.
Hey!  I told you to get your spirit up!
@BATTLE
Kai, right?
Yes, Kanchou. Did you need something?
A while back, you were arguing with Kitakami about her armor, right?
It's just... difficult to get her to listen sometimes.

Fields.MenuText: I just want to make sure there's not some issue between you two.
You often get into arguments like that?
She's really against adding protection?

Fields.DialogueText: No issue. We just agree to disagree.
Sometimes. She's fairly opinionated.
She isn't the biggest fan of change.
And you consider her lack of armor a serious issue?
If it was, she wouldn't be on the water. But there's a fair amount of research suggesting that Belles can carry greater loads than dormant ships - so maybe there's room for improvement.
... Though, yes, it'd be nice to be able to take a few more hits.
You're not kidding.
It's not that easy, though. Too much refitting too fast and Belles seem to go back into hibernation. It's got to be paced.
So, no rushing her. No pressuring her. No nothing. It'll happen in its own time.
Kanchou.
*ALARM*
Time to beat up these Morganas and prove I know what I'm doing!
@BATTLE
Look at that, Kanchou, we're already done. Think we broke the record for fastest battle?
You know that I'm impressed with your speed.
As you should be!
And, for what it's worth, I've had a talk with Kai, and he...
Blah! Don't tell me he's got you trying to sell me on more stupid tons of stupid steel!

Fields.MenuText: In fairness, he does make some good points.
No. Basically exactly the opposite.
Steel is stupid, now?

Fields.DialogueText: No. He makes some dumb points.
This better not be some reverse psychology thing!
Kai is stupid and it's catching. You better watch out!
Huh.
They're not improvements. They'll slow me down. Speed is fun!
Wait, where are you running off to?
Come on, race me. I'll show you how fun being fast really is!
... Yeah, there's no way I'm beating her in a footrace.
Okay, just so I know, what's so wrong with making a few improvements to the ship?
Here comes another battle to dance through quickly!
You're taking a risk...
@BATTLE
Kanchou, I figured it out!
Fantastic! What are we talking about?
I'm talking about the boredom plaguing this ship! I've got the perfect idea to lift everyone's spirits!
Everyone? You're really the only one I've heard complaining about boredom.
Trust me, people are bored.
Well, what's your idea?
Music.
You mean like instruments?
No, I can't play anything. I'm talking about records!
Records? And what would you play them on?
Okay, you can keep poking holes in my plan, or you can let me make some inquiries. I'm sure I can trade for everything we need.

Fields.MenuText: Just nothing drastic, okay?
Stop being ridiculous. We don't need music on a warship.
This doesn't exactly sound like a productive use of your time.

Fields.DialogueText: Have a little faith. I promise I won't do anything you wouldn't do.
A warship is exactly where there should be music. Saying otherwise is stupid!
It's either this or sitting around moping. Which sounds more productive to you?
I assume we're done here. I've got to start looking around for our new music.
I guess it's better than her trying to buy a bunch of axes for everyone.
Oh, no - here come Morganas!  I hope we're stocked enough to beat them!
@BATTLE
We've reached port, Captain, and we are ready to resupply.
I thought we'd check over what we're getting. I brought a list.
Excellent. Nothing I like more than inventory lists...
What this here? I'm seeing a lot of items just marked ceremonial...?
Oh, well, that was from Miss Kitakami. She assured us you'd be fine with them.
That makes... so much sense.
Hey, Kanchou, what's--- judging by that look on your face... I'm going to guess you noticed.
I did.
You're going to thank me later.

Fields.MenuText: You're not getting a bunch of "ceremonial" axes. You can forget about it.
Why would I thank you later?
How about I thank you now and you stop going behind my back?

Fields.DialogueText: They're not all axes. They're investments! Trust me!
Because if you listen to me, you'll be a rich kanchou at the end of this war.
I wouldn't have to go behind your back if you had more of an open mind.
What exactly was your plan?
Buy low, sell high. After the war these things are going to be worth, like, double. It's called investing.
The idea of profiting from war leaves a bad taste in my mouth.
You'll get over it. If you wanna be rich.
Better luck next time, Kitakami.
Shoot.
Even you've gotta admit it'd be super awesome!
It might be.
Just imagine it. Flying toward them, they'd see their lives flash before their eyes just as it stops inches above their head. Oooh, I bet they'd even have an accident!
No one will ever agree to that.
I'm not so sure about that. I think our perfect volunteer just arrived.
I assume you're talking about me.
Oh, you're so smart, Kanchou! Do me a favor and hold this apple for me. Right above your head.

Fields.MenuText: Above my head? What's going on here?
Didn't anyone ever tell you not to play with your food?
Whatever's going on here, I want nothing to do with it.

Fields.DialogueText: Just trust me, you're going to love it.
I'm not playing with food. I'm going to eat it, I just have to cut it first.
Oh, poo, you're no fun, Kanchou!
I'd advise you to drop that apple, Kanchou.
Don't listen to him. It's like he doesn't trust my aim or something.
Your aim? And... why are you pulling out an axe?
I'm going to toss my axe and split the apple. Right over your head. Could you just stand on the other side of the room, please? Thank you.
Absolutely not. Under no circumstances is this ever going to happen.
But, Kanchoooooouu...
Told you so.
@BATTLE
I'm glad you've stopped griping about my axe!
Yes, well. I figure if carrying it around gives you exercise, I might as well tolerate it.
Hey, Kanchou. Do you like to hunt?

Fields.MenuText: It's not really my idea of a good time.
I find it an enjoyable hobby.
Like... kicking a football?

Fields.DialogueText: Aw, that's too bad.
Really? That's one more thing we have in common then!
What? No, that's punting. I'm talking about hunting animals.
Why are you bringing this up now?
It's just that there's not much to do on board, other than battle Morganas.
Weren't you going to try and find music for the ship or something?
Yeah, that wasn't as easy as I thought it would be, so now I'm on to hunting!
And you think hunting will be easier? What are you going to hunt on a ship?
Rats.
We do have a bit of a rodent issue. It'd actually be a pretty productive use of your time.
Yeah, and it'd be a great opportunity to pass on all my knowledge to you.
You want me to go hunting with you?
Well, someone's gotta take care of the rat problem.
Yeah, but does it have to be--
See you in a bit, Kanchou!
It's like arguing with a brick wall sometimes.
@BATTLE
Darn, Morganas!  Looks like those rats will have to wait!
@BATTLE
How's the damage looking?
Not as bad as I expected. I think the bad guys' aim is getting better.
I think Kitakami would want me to say something positive about her ability to dodge the worst of it. So consider it said.
She's still not enthusiastic about extra armor, I take it?
Honestly, she seems more concerned with finding some way to entertain herself on board.
Sounds like her.
Kanchou! It's time.

Fields.MenuText: If you hand me an apple again, I'm running!
You look excited. Is there something I'm forgetting about?
When you come to me with that axe out, I know to be worried.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, calm down. I'm not about to try that again. At least not yet.
How could you forget? This is the funnest thing to happen on board since I put glue in the oatmeal.
It's ceremonial. It's not like I'm waving a machine gun all over the place!
What's going on?
I'm passing on all my hunting knowledge to the Kanchou.
You were serious about that?
Of course. Who else is going to deal with all those pesky rats?
It's too late for me. You should get out of here before she tries to rope you into this too.
Don't act like you're not going to enjoy this!
I think I'm needed. Elsewhere. Good luck.
The first rule of hunting is knowing your environment.
Well, I'm the captain of the ship, and you are the ship, so I'd say we know the environment pretty well!
Good point. We can skip that then. The second rule is knowing your prey. You have to put yourself in their shoes.
Well, rats don't wear shoes so... can we skip this rule too?
Take this serious, Kanchou! Think like a rat.

Fields.MenuText: Kitakami's being serious? I must be dreaming.
I guess I'd be hiding and keeping an eye out for food.
I don't know. When do we start shooting stuff?

Fields.DialogueText: Hunting is not the time for jokes. That's how people get hurt.
Exactly. That's why we're in the mess hall.
We're not going to start shooting at the rats. That's a little overkill, even for me.
Now keep an eye out for small holes and cracks. Anywhere that the rodents could be hiding in.
And then?
Don't get ahead of yourself, Kanchou!
It's just that I'd like to get this over--
Shh! I think I heard something.
You were even louder than me!
Shhhh!
*ALARM*
Oh, I guess I was hearing Morganas, not rats.
They're more important, if you ask me.
@BATTLE
Good thing that distraction didn't last long!
I suppose so.
Time for your next lesson! The perfect bait and the perfect trap!

Fields.MenuText: Kitakami, I'm the captain of this ship. I have more important things to do.
Oh, sounds interesting.
Still sounds pretty basic. When do we get to the more intense stuff?

Fields.DialogueText: This is important. If we leave these rats to plunder our food stores, they could leave us hungry and diseased. Is that what you want, Kanchou?!
It is interesting. With the right bait, anything will fall for a trap.
Oh, someone's impatient. You have to walk before you can crawl, Kanchou.
We do have to make this quick, though. I have a meeting I can't be late for.
Well, let's start with an easy question then. What do rodents love more than anything?
I want to say cheese, but that seems too obvious.
I said it was an easy question. The hard part is the trap. Most rats are actually too smart or too quick to fall for the normal mouse trap.
So what do we do to trap them?
Oh, that's for me to worry about. You've got a meeting to get to.
And we were just getting to the good part!
Be less busy and we can have more fun.
If only I had that option. Hope you enjoy yourself.
Oh, I will.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, we have a bit of a situation.
What is it?
It's about Kitakami.

Fields.MenuText: Of course it is. Why am I not surprised?
Don't tell me she tried to throw a hatchet at you.
Get to the point. I don't have all day.

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, she can be a bit of a troublemaker. A pretty big one in this case.
A hatchet? Lord no. I'm actually grateful that this was all she did now.
Yes, of course, Kanchou. Sorry to interrupt your busy day.
So we were sitting together at lunch. And when I finished, I went to stand up, only...
Only I stood up with him. Against my will.
Somehow Kitakami sewed our uniforms together without us noticing.
That would explain why the two of you are standing so close together, but how do you know it was Kitakami?
She pointed and laughed at us, saying, "Gotcha!"
... Yeah, that checks out. I'll have a talk with her.
We'd appreciate it. Thank you.
In the meantime... change into some new uniforms. You don't want to be caught in a battle dressed like that, do you?
Yes, Captain.
@BATTLE
Kitakami, we need to have a conversation.
Hmmm? About what? You ready to go check my trap? See if we caught any rats?
No, I'm more concerned about some of the reports I've been getting about you lately.
Reports? It kinda sounds like I'm in trouble!

Fields.MenuText: Well, you are.
I'm mostly just disappointed.
Oh, I can't be mad at you when you use that face on me.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm in trouble? I can't be in trouble. I'm the Belle.
Oh, man, that's even worse.
Yatta! The puppy dog eyes work again!
Can you explain why I've gotten several complaints about you playing pranks on officers in the mess hall?
Oh, that's what this is about? That's just me spreading cheer! Pranks are fun! Everyone loves them!
Maybe to you and everyone watching, but not the people being pranked.
Oh... I think I see your point.
Really? I'm glad. That was easier than I thought it would be.
So I need to prank everyone evenly. So that everyone gets a chance to laugh!
Uh, that's not really what I was trying to--
Thanks, Kanchou. Good talk. I know exactly what I've gotta do now.
... This isn't going to be good.
@BATTLE
Kitakami!
Kitakami, please don't tell me you're already too caught up in this nonsense to hear me!
Kitakami?
Kanchou... Kitakami has gotten out of control.
I'd throw her in the brig, but I'm afraid she'd just pass the time booby-trapping it.
I may have an idea.

Fields.MenuText: I'm listening.
It seems like you know her pretty well.
You think your ideas are better than mine?

Fields.DialogueText: Good.
We've been friendly for some time now.
I wouldn't say that. But it's worth a shot.
We need to purchase her some poetry.
Poetry? I was under the impression she wasn't much of a reader.
Poetry's different. A good book of poems will get her in a completely different mood. A calmer mood.
It's worth a shot. You got anything specific in mind?
Yes, actually. You can leave it to me.
@BATTLE
Fair enough. And, listen, I'll cover the cost as long as it's even halfway reasonable.
That said... you do realize that if you and she are collaborating to prank *me* your time on this ship will be a living hell, right?
... I do now. And we're not. Kanchou.
Get ready to say wow, Kanchou!
That's the trap you put together?
Yes it is. Ingenious, right?

Fields.MenuText: It seems pretty complicated. Overly so.
I have to give it to you. It's impressive.
That thing is hideous.

Fields.DialogueText: It might be a little more complicated than it needed to be, but it's all in the name of rodent eradication!
Well, thank ya!  I worked pretty hard on it.
It's not about how it looks. It's about how it kills rats.
I started with an ordinary rat trap, then I added fly paper to stick to the rat when it approaches.
Oh, and I also weighed down the bait with a number of ball bearings so it couldn't get away.
You really put a lot of thought into this. So should we just wait here and watch it?
If we just stand here then the rats will never come out. We'll have to come back later to check on it. And the others.
The others? You made more of these monsters?
Yeah, this isn't the only one. I placed about a dozen of these babies all over. Not counting the prototypes.
Prototypes?
Yup. Genius isn't made on the first try!
I feel sorry for the rats.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, I have some good news related to our problems.
By all means share it.
I found it, Kanchou. Guaranteed to put Kitakami in a more somber mood.

Fields.MenuText: Somber? I don't want to depress her.
These are pretty thick books for poetry.
Fantastic! I'm not sure the crew could handle too many more pranks.

Fields.DialogueText: A good poem can evoke emotions. She won't be depressed, she'll just be less hectic. Trust me.
They're anthologies and collections. They're from a number of poets that Kitakami has approved of in the past.
My thoughts exactly. I'm worried she was getting close to pranking me.
The next time you see Kitakami, give her these.
And you're sure this will be enough to put a stop to her pranking the crew?
I'm hopeful, Kanchou. I know her pretty well.
You do seem to. Surprisingly well, even.
She considers me a close friend. And I feel the same.
Hmmm...
Just give her the books. No more pranks. Though she will start talking about poetry almost non-stop.
That sounds like the lesser of two evils.
Cheap at double the price, I'd say.
Music to my wallet's ears, so to speak. Thank you, Kai.
*ALARM*
So much for music.
@BATTLE
Youch! My poor foot! What is this thing and why are there so many of them?
Uh oh, sounds like you caught something in your traps, Kitakami - just not a rat.
Oops, heh, sorry about that. Ya definitely weren't the intended target.
Why are you laughing?! It's not funny. I'm lucky I didn't lose a toe!
It's just the look on your face. It's kinda priceless.

Fields.MenuText: You'd agree if you had a mirror.
Kitakami, don't make fun of the man.
If you think you were bored before, then keep this up, Kitakami.

Fields.DialogueText: Totally! Someone go find a mirror. You're gonna laugh, trust me!
Fine, I'll try to contain myself.
Yikes, you're scary when you use that tone!
This is the opposite of appropriate. You should be apologizing to me, not laughing!
He has a point, Kitakami. You could've seriously injured him.
I guess you're right. Sorry. I'll try to let the crew know about my traps next time.
Apology accepted.
Nice job, Kitakami.
Hehehehe, at least we know my traps work.
@BATTLE
This is going to be so much fun!
Kitakami, you have a second?
Can it wait a minute? I'm working on my next big prank. It involves glue, Kai, and one of those rats I caught.

Fields.MenuText: You have me intrigued. Tell me more.
In that case, it's urgent.
Take your time, I'll just wait over here.

Fields.DialogueText: No way! It's more fun if you're surprised by it.
Urgent? Sounds important. I guess this can wait.
I can't keep working if you're watching over my shoulder like that.
So what do you need, Kanchou?
I actually got you something.
Got me something? Like a present?
Yeah. It's something I'm hoping will help stave off your boredom.
Well, what is it?
I heard from a rather large bird in a naval uniform that you liked poetry, so here's a rather large collection of it. From both of us - and probably the rest of the crew in spirit.
It was Kai, wasn't it?
Maybe.
I'll have to thank him later. This is too much, Kanchou. It's incredibly thoughtful, of both of you. I don't know what to say.
Just enjoy them for the days to come, and keep yourself entertained. That's all the thanks I need.
You can bet on it, Kanchou!
@BATTLE
It's been fairly quiet recently.
I know, and it's all thanks to you.
Speaking of, where is Kitakami?
I ordered her to bed. She looked like she hadn't slept in a year.
She'll do that. Not a fan of small doses, that one.
I've noticed that.
I'd prepare yourself for this quiet to end. Kitakami is always the most energetic just after she wakes up.

Fields.MenuText: Honestly, that's when I most enjoy her. She's got a passion.
As long as she's not pulling pranks on the crew, I'll deal with a little noise.
You said the poetry would calm her down a little, right? Maybe she'll wake up a new person.

Fields.DialogueText: She does have quite the zest for life. She always has.
It's certainly the better alternative.
Doubtful, Kitakami will always be Kitakami.
I've been meaning to ask you something for a while now.
Ask away.
You seem really close with Kitakami. How--
*ALARM*
And there's the end of our silence.
What are you two doing? We've got Morganas to beat down!
I guess I'll have to ask my question later. Let's go.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, do you have a moment?
Yes, actually.
Kanchou, I think I've figured out a way to properly thank you for my present.

Fields.MenuText: I don't need anything, Kitakami. I'm just happy you're happy.
If you should be thanking anyone, it's Kai.
About time. I've been waiting for at least a thank you card.

Fields.DialogueText: That's sweet, but not good enough.
Oh, I tossed out that rat I captured so he's safe. For now. That's thanks enough.
Well, I don't have a card, but I do have something even better!
Here, this is for you. I want you to have it.
Your axe?
Yeah, it means a lot to me, and I figure it's a good way to show you how happy you made me.
You don't have to do this, Kitakami.
Just take it already! Oh, but be careful, it's ceremonial after all.
I'll be careful. I promise. Thank you, Kitakami.
*ALARM*
Oh, looks like you'll get a chance to put that axe to good use.
I thought it was ceremonial!
Hehehehe.
@BATTLE
Hey, Kanchou? What are you doing right now?
Just finishing up some paperwork. Why? Do you need me?
Kind of...
What's going on?
Well, I've been reading all the poetry you got me, and I was wondering if... maybe you'd like to talk about it with me.
Talk about it with you? I haven't really read it.
Well, we could read it together. Doesn't that sounds really fun?!

Fields.MenuText: Not really...
Yeah, it does, Kitakami. I'm onboard.

Fields.DialogueText: What?! Well, too bad! We're doing it anyway. This is going to be so fun! Just you wait and see.
I'm so happy to hear that, Kanchou! This is going to be so fun! Just you wait and see.
I'll keep my fingers crossed.
